MAINTAIN BEATS OF

Too much action all the time in a game can drain 
the players. Instead, an ideal campaign needs a 
cyclical pace of action and relaxation. A scene of 
discussions with NPCs might lead to a battle. That

THE 2016 
DUNGEONS & DRAGONS 
DUNGEON MASTER SURVEY

"What is the highest-level D&D campaign you've 
run or played in?"

"For fifth edition Dungeon Masters, do you roll 
your dice in the open or hide them?"

"Fifth edition Dungeon Masters, do you plan NPCs 
ahead of time or improvise them at the table?"

"DMs, how do you build monster encounters when 
preparing your D&D game?"

"D&D players, of the three pillars of D&D game 
play, which do you enjoy the most?"

"5e DMs, do you regularly alter monster hit 
points during combat?"
